user.bio: I am a University of New South Wales PhD graduate. I completed a Bachelor of Sciences degree, and focused on Agricultural Sciences for my Masters. I graduated in 2007 and have since worked on increasing my knowledge on other areas. I have been writing research essays and articles for submission into many online databases.

I am a coding specialist that works for the Nelson Brothers company in Adelaide, SA. I have worked there since 1998, and now have gained an interest in sharing my knowledge with others. My favourite colour is Purple and I live with my 3 children, aged 4, 13, 16, and my husband.

I have been submitting my scholarly works to various online platforms since graduating with my Masters degree from the Australian National University in Canberra, ACT, Australia. I write about topics I am passionate about, however focus on Practices of Medicine in Australia, and research issues and challenges with current methods, as well as advocating for changes to better reflect changes in society, and advancements in medicines.

I am an enthusiastic writer about Architectural History, focusing on the changing ideals in modern architecture, dating from the 18th century up to the 21st century. My hobbies include designing small-scale environments using 3D technologies to model societies specific to time periods.
